snippet: The debate has been renewed on social media and beyond about whether the flag should be displayed, and whether politicians should continue to defend it.
abstract: South Carolina is being forced to confront Confederate battle flag flying above grounds of State House in Columbia following racially-motivated massacre at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church; NAACP has demanded removal of flag, calling it emblem of hate.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and MANNY FERNANDEZ
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Charleston, and Manny Fernandez from Houston. Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The debate has been renewed on social media and beyond about whether the flag should be displayed, and whether politicians should continue to defend it.
